p: The daily peaks of pollen concentration were observed in the years 1994 (1100 p/m 3 in March), 1999 (1460 p/m 3 in April), and in 2001 (800 p/m 3 in April) whilst a very low maximum value (<150 p/m 3) was observed in 1993 and 2000 ( Figure 4). In the other years, the daily peaks were about 200â€“600 p/m 3 and, in general, were reached in April. In all years, the pollen shows a decreasing trend in summer with some re-increase of concentration in June due to the blooming of Alnus viridis (especially visible in 1994 (see also [ 25])).
